explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid or solid substances at 140degC are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no oxygen , chlorine and fluorine.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Liquid at a test temperature, 55degC. Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: SPECIES: Rat ENDPOINT: LD50 VALUE: 1450 mg/kg, 1640 mg/kg REFERENCE SOURCE: BUA 217 (2000)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: From description that mortality was not observed at 2000mg/kg in the dermal administration test using rats (BUA 217 (2000)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: There was description that death was not acknowledged by rat 4-hour exposure of 2.8mg/L in the inhalation exposure test (BUA 217 (2000)). But there is no data in the concentration beyond this, and it cannot classify since data is insufficient for carrying out the outside of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is possibility of being out of Category from statement that irritation was not observed in the rabbit skin irritation test (BUA 217 (2000)). But there is no statement in Priority 1that clearly negates hazard, it cannot be classified.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is possibility besides Category from description that transient redness is only admitted and that it is in the test applied to the eye of the rabbit (BUA 217 (2000)). But there being no data which negates hazard clearly in Priority 1, it cannot classifications.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Category1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)-; (Skin sensitization)May cause allergic skin reaction
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: No data Skin sensitization: Classified as Category 1 because BUA 217 (2000) describes a large number of reports that show positive sensitization in humans.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing genetic defects (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there are positive results from the micronucleus tests using mouse erythrocytes, which are in vivo mutagenicity tests using somatic cells (BUA 217, 2000, RETCS, 2005), there is no positive result from in vivo genotoxicity tests using germ cells. So the substance was classified as Category 2.

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: It is classified into category 2 in EU (EU-Annex I, a proposal year is unknown). But it is classified into 2B (IARC Suppl.7, 1987) according to IARC and is classified into 2B (Japan Society for Occupational Health recommendation, 1991 proposals) in Japan Society for Occupational Health. So it was set as Category 2 according to the section of Japan Society for Occupational Health which is the latest evaluation document.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 (blood). Due to the description of increasing methemoglobin concentration and cyanosis were observed in the inhalation exposure test using rat in BUA 217 (2000).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour EC50=0.07mg/L of Crustacea (Ceriodaphnia) (BUA217, 2000).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bioaccumulative (BCF=42.4 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
